abstracts.cdata!:
The long-term objectives of the overall
            Agribusiness and Agricultural Markets Development Project
            for Senegal is to create the conditions for rapid
            agricultural growth, driven by greater competitiveness in
            domestic and export markets, and double participant producer
            revenues. This environmental impact assessment (EIA) report
            evaluated the following impactcs : use of pesticides;
            erosion; social conflicts among project beneficiaries;
            damage caused by irrigation works to surrounding areas; use
            of ground and surface water; access routes to rice fields
            and their maintenance; topography of irrigated agriculture
            fields; pump stations specifications; and public health. As
            a result of this assessment the EIA suggest mitigation
            measures, including : establishment of : la Direction de la
            Promotion des Vegetaux (DPV) for control of pest
            infestations in rice, tomato, vegetables, cotton, sugar
            cane, farming; better coordination among lab members of
            " la Commission Nationale de Gestion des Produits
            Chimiques "; better control for elimination of
            pesticides residual on horticultural products; monitor
            surface and ground water quality; adopt proper protection
            measures to avoid erosion; install safe and suitable
            housings for pumps and generators; train and educate farmers
            in environmental safety practices for correct use of
            pesticides; inform general public of schedules for pest
            eradication (phytosanitary) campaigns; use pesticides
            recommended by the OMS/AFRO (World Health
            Organization/Africa); use non-chemical pesticides, such as
            biological methods (insects parasites, mushrooms, etc.,);
            promote the use of varieties resistant to pest infestation;
            and finally, reinforce the institutional capacity of health
            districts for better control of vector disease production.
